channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 04/10/25
item.content:encoded:
It might have been the launch of one of the PS5’s biggest exclusives yet, in the form of Ghost of Yotei, this week, but it was EA and Microsoft that stole the headlines away with the former announcing plans to be bought out by Saudi Arabia, and Xbox Game Pass getting a massive price increase. Let’s dive in and see what else has happened this week.

In the News This Week

  • Xbox Game Pass Ultimate gets Ubisoft+ Classics, Fortnite Crew and a ridiculous price increase
  • Avalanche Liverpool to close after Contraband is put on hold
  • Electronic Arts goes private, will be owned by the Saudi’s and Trump’s Son In law
  • SAG-AFTRA make a fresh statement opposing the use of synthetic AI performers
  • Demeo x Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked get a November release and a Steam Next Fest demo
  • The Last Caretaker launches into early access this November
  • Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault has been delayed until November
  • Rejoice! It’s 2025 and you can buy brand new Atari 7800 cartridges
  • PlayStation is coming to Magic the Gathering, again!

Games in Review & Featured Articles

A ton of games passed through our reviews this week, with not one but two LEGO games!

  • Digimon Story Time Stranger – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 – NSW2, NSW – 8/10 (video review)
  • LEGO Party – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • EA Sports FC 26 – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Blippo+ – NSW, PC, Playdate – 7/10
  • LEGO Voyagers – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, PS4, NSW, PC – 7/10
  • UBOAT – PS5, XSX|S – 6/10
  • Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 6/10
  • Discounty – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 5/10

Beyond the reviews, I went hands on with Jurassic World Evolution 3 as it brings natural dino breeding into the mix, while Dom delivered previews of Tiny Metal 2’s revamped turn-based strategy, Ball X Pit and its ball bouncing antics, and the slick and stylish upcoming roguelite Morbid Metal.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Super Mario Galaxy, Digimon Story Time Stranger & Hades 2.

Trailer Park

Watch over eight minutes of The Relic: First Guardian gameplay

The KPop Demon Hunters have dropped into Fortnite for some Demon Rush PvE

Skate Season 1 arrives next week to get you looking Hesh & Fresh

Your Achievements

Let’s see what you’ve been playing?

  • TSBonyman checked in with an update of his gaming antics, having run through plenty more No Man’s Sky with the custom ship designing, a cheap copy of Atomic Heart which impressed with its style, but less so its gameplay, and the System Shock remake for some classic immersive sim action. He’s also enjoyed Steamworld Dig 2 and Steamworld Heist, which are still lovely indie games.

That’s the round up for this week’s round up, enjoy the weekend, and we’ll catch you for more gaming shenanigans next week!



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/10/04/something-for-the-weekend-04-10-25/
